Articles.Content: Back in my days there was snow in winter.

Back in my day you had to use *70 to not get kicked off the internet.

045006152022
Back in my day there were 4 defined seasons that made sense.

6 hours ago, ColdJ said:

Back in my day there were 4 defined seasons that made sense.

The modern "spinoffs", "sequels", and "prequels" are really annoying.

Take the "Walking Dead",  for example, with at least three spin-offs with their own seasons.
Back in my day trains had manual doors that were rarely shut and school kids used to hang out them while the train was moving. 90% survived doing that.

Back in my days there was no TetraPak cans for milk.

Wait...

There was no Coca and Pepsi, too.

Wow, you are old if there was no Coca.

Back in my day, the first tetra pack was a triangular pyramid and only had 4 sides, it contained an orange flavoured ice block.

back in my day,the earth (had an slightly elliptical orbit at about 146G meters around sol (which was a yellow dwarf with expected life expectancy of 5 billion years) )and was having (71% water and 29% land) and was having 9an atmosphere that was (78%nitrogen and 20% oxygen and about 1% argon) and about 100km in height) and had (a radius of 6371km and a circumfrence on equator about 40000km)
Back in my day we didn't assume we knew the daily routine of dinosaurs.
Back in my day we use a power called "electricity".

Back in my day sliding rules didn't look funny.

(For me - they still don't.)
Back in my day, we built and flew rockets in a video game, not launch homemade interstellar probes to alpha centauri every few days.
Back in my day, the pines behind our windows were thrice lower.
Back in my day, we locked the door when leaving the house instead of erecting a forcefield around it to keep people out.

back in my day the forums only had 4 million total posts

On 7/16/2022 at 3:05 AM, Space Kerbalisation Tech said:

Back in my day, we built and flew rockets in a video game, not launch homemade interstellar probes to alpha centauri every few days

from a different multiverse that we got to by going through white holes and wormholes.

back in my day mechjeb was the most popular mod and had 1000000000000000000000000000000000 downloads

back in my day, the starship was on a daily basis of ~200 explosions a week, the falcon heavy had only 2 boosters and the falcon 9 upper stage wasn't reusable
back in my day, i didn't know how to check my stagings! resulting in total unplanned planned dissasembly as 4 year old me laughed maniacally

Back in my day, you actually had to eat and drink! You couldn't just insert water and protein packs into the slot on your hip!

Spoiler

.

Edited July 24, 2022 by Second Hand Rocket Science
Back in my day the milk got delivered to your door in glass bottles.
Keep the politics out, please.
Back in my day the milk was pumped from cows instead of growing on palms.
Back in my day, having palms got you dates.
Back in my day, there were no Kerbals.
Back in my day there were no Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles.

Back in my day there were no Star Wars.

Edited July 29, 2022 by kerbiloid
Back in my day there was 1 Star Wars, it had an intermission and was not called "A New Hope."
